intro: Callista crocata, commonly known as the golden bell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Callista crocata thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments.
